content: AMA 1M65 CPF Investments Asked by Sean TanAsked on 03 Nov 2018What did you invest in with your cpf?What did you invest in with your cpf? I want to grow my cpf quick.6 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (6)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Nov 2018Leave your money in your CPF Ordinary and Special Account unless you are sure of getting a return more than 2.5% or 4% respectively. Think carefully before you invest your money in CPF, especially in the current market situation. 0 comments2

Loo Cheng ChuanLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Nov 2018Google 1M65 and my name. You will find some answers there. The risk of quick returns goes up exponentially , so i would advocate some patience in your CPF investment, since you can't touch them until 55 anyway. 0 comments2

Teo See Hwa, MArketing Associate at PropnexLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 05 Nov 2018When young Leverage what you have, when old deleverage.Risk is something your don't know, when you get enough info the risk level reduce.0 comments0

Luke Ho, Money Maverick at Money MaverickLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Nov 2018High yield funds such as in India and China. It'd be pie for me to pick out some that have done anywhere between 8 to double digit annualized net of fees. And since it has nowhere else to go (you cant spend it)...0 comments0

Yixiong ChangLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 03 Nov 2018How about transferring your OA funds to SA, you will get 4% guaranteed return, risk free. Unless you require OA to buy a house. If then, you wouldnt really want to take risk with your OA money anyway. 0 comments0

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 03 Nov 2018You can invest in stocks or set up a globally diversified portfolio from a Financial Advisor with asset allocation aligned with your risk profile. I would also recommend to only invest your OA and not your SA because of the risk free interest. 0 comments0
